title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4045.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4045.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

The following terms, when used in this Part, have the
following meanings: (a) ARCI Penalty

Guidelines means the uniform classification guidelines published in "Uniform

Classification Guidelines for Foreign Substances and Recommended Penalties and

Model Rule," Version 13.0 (approved December 9, 2016) of the Association of

Racing Commissioners International, Inc., 1510 Newtown Pike, Suite 210, Lexington, KY 40511, which are hereby incorporated by reference. Such Uniform

Rules of Racing are available for public inspection at the New York State

Gaming Commission, 354 Broadway, Schenectady, NY 12305 and at the Department of

State, 99 Washington Avenue, Albany, NY 12231. (b) Equine drug rule means any law, rule, regulation or order that restricts the administration to, or presence in, a
racehorse of a drug or other substance in New York or another racing
jurisdiction. (c) Final
adjudication means a ruling or order of a racing commission that is not
currently subject to an administrative or judicial stay, and if such ruling or
order is subjected subsequently to a stay, then the ruling or order existing
after any such stay ends. (d) Precipitating equine drug rule violation means an equine drug rule violation
committed in New York that causes or may cause, depending on the final
adjudication of a ruling or order of a racing commission, the penalties of this
section to apply. (e) Racing
commission means the agency regulating horse racing in a jurisdiction that has
horse racing and pari-mutuel wagering. Notes

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
